correctVerb.question: They ______ at the mall only to discover that thousands of people were already covering every inch of the pavements with sleeping bags, blankets and tents.
Stan ______ his breakfast to be on the table by the time he walked into the kitchen.
He ______ a bath four times a year on important holidays. No one was going to accuse Stan of wasting his hard earned cash on soap.
He ______ Dotty of her elder brother.

verbConjugation.task: 3) Put the verb in the correct form
verbConjugation.question: Canberra __________________(CHOOSE) as the capital because Sydney and Melbourne could not stop arguing which city should be the capital of Australia.

verbConjugation.task: 3) Put the verb in the correct form
verbConjugation.question: 80 % of Australians believe Australia has a strong culture and identity characterised by honesty, sports and multiculturalism based on research __________________(ORGANISE) by the Australia Day Council of NSW in 2008.

verbConjugation.task: 3) Put the verb in the correct form
verbConjugation.question: He ________(SEE) a goat feeding on grass on top of a high cliff. The wolf wished to get the goat to climb down from the rock and into his grasp and he called out to her.

verbConjugation.task: 3) Put the verb in the correct form
verbConjugation.question: But the goat knew too well of the wolf’s intent. “You __________________ (NOT CARE)if I eat good grass or bad.

other.question: Which celebrities would you like to be if you were famous?
What would you buy first if you received $1 million tomorrow?
Are you a big spender? What things do you buy more often than others?
What meal of the day do you like the most: breakfast, lunch, dinner, or supper? And why?

wordTransformation.task: 5) Transform a word to make it grammatically appropriate
wordTransformation.question: Everybody knows Walt Disney, a person who invented many cartoon characters such as Donald Duck and Pluto. But it's Mickey Mouse that __________________(LOVE) by children all over the world.

wordTransformation.task: 5) Transform a word to make it grammatically appropriate
wordTransformation.question: However, few people know about the following fact. The funny thing is that Walt Disney, its creator, had a strong phobia – he was very much afraid of __________________(MOUSE)!

wordTransformation.task: 5) Transform a word to make it grammatically appropriate
wordTransformation.question: Everybody began asking __________________(THEY) to play together, so they agreed.

wordTransformation.task: 5) Transform a word to make it grammatically appropriate
wordTransformation.question: Don't forget that nearby is the ancient and __________________(MYSTERY) Stonehenge, a circle of enormous rocks on the edge of the Salisbury Plain.

wordTransformation.task: 5) Transform a word to make it grammatically appropriate
wordTransformation.question: How would you like to go to school on Saturdays? If you lived in Japan, that's just where you _____________(BE) each Saturday morning. Japanese students attend classes five and a half days a week. The half day is on Saturday.

wordTransformation.task: 5) Transform a word to make it grammatically appropriate
wordTransformation.question: It is also interesting to know that the Japanese school year is one of the ______________(LONG) in the world - over 240 days. It begins in the month of April.

correctNoun.question: It is the kind of dust that gets into the throat and between the _________ of bare brown feet.
Then Daniel met Rachel, who had arrived a year after them, and fell in love with her at first ______.
I loved the half of the novel, which was told from his point of _______
I grew up on Third Avenue in midtown Manhattan during the 1950s-60s where family life was centred around old ______ of flats and small stores.
